reviewText:
Strange blend of genres but works well. Similar to a tower defense game minus the towers. Replaced with disposable units to counter an attacking army that you battle on top of a pizza.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLHuu5DXje0
Earlier levels don't last long but quickly increased in difficulty, perhaps even needing some tweaks. Got a little frustrated due to the perfection required for stopping the onslaught at times. Other then enemy units, the other challenge faced is the moisture level, energy used for spawning units and using their special abilities. While limited and slow to regenerate, it can be increased through completion of levels and spending acquired funds on passive boosts or unit upgrades.

No screen resolutions available instead scaling to fullscreen or running in a 720p window. Sliders were available for music and sound. Mouse or gamepad worked fine but could not be remapped and worth nothing was pad needed to be unplugged otherwise game suffered from odd menu behavior. Reasonable amount of content and didn't touch the pvp or co-op modes, believe the later may only be supported locally. Nice artstyle though graphics don't stay as crisp as I would like running fullscreen. Phone port but a good one, without any micro-transactions. Huzzah.

reviewText:
A colorful and unconventional take on the Tug-Of-War mechanic. You could replace mold with fantasy monster and the enemies with knights, but that would be only have as funny. 2 hours in I got a variety of tanks, archers and suicide bombers and according to the screenshots, there is a lot more to go around. Also, how many TOW games have coop?

Truly deserves a lot more attention. Very challenging. Too challenging at times.

On the bad side, I miss the option to rebind keys, or did I just miss" that?"

reviewText:
I have barely started this game and I'm already in love. The molds are so cute, as are the preservatives, the controls are simple to understand (once you get used to them) and I already want to waste away my life with this game. I found myself repeatedly playing 1-10 as I kept wanting to beat my score. I just can't seem to last even a minute. I haven't had a chance to play with a controler, but I think the keyboard and set-up is my preference. (To me, the controller looks harder to use.)

Edit: Learned the 1-7 hotkeys on the keyboard without realizing they were shown on screen. I'd suggest when you start to take a good look at the screen and then restart the level. That's how I got my head round some of the levels.

10/10 would yell at friends to get it so we can PVP
10/10 would cuddle mold
10/10 would host a pizza party with this as entertainment

reviewText: I have only gotten slightly past the first world/topping, but it has been a fun casual strategy game so far. Unit types have pretty varied so far and allow both you and your enemy to have some interesting combinations and formations.\n\nGame has been challanging a few times for me so far, and there is also a level rating system for you to attempt for a perfect 3 star score if the levels are too easy. Game also contains upgrades and customization that allow you to tweak your stats for just the advantage you need.

reviewText: Looking for another PvZ?  This is about as far from it as it gets.  It is a spam clickfest that is mildly not painful for 20 minutes then sucks.  Spend your money on something more fun... like a small rock.

reviewText:
This looked like a cute fun kind of game
Knew right away something was off the controls were downright awkward
but I fumbled around for a bit with the controller manage to make my way into level one
where i was thrown into a battle without so much as a hello
that lasted all of 5 seconds, i had beaten it before i it was over
i'm certian it wasn't because i understood a single thing i had just done with the controller
the second level was none better
and I had advanced yet i had no idea how to operate the controls
didn't matter, it was all over and done in a flash and there's this adorable little preservative laughing at me
back to fumbling with screens, try to beat it a couple times
the levels are paced at a ridiculous speed
those screen shots?  well, i'll never see them
this game is terrible
terrible
and I paid money for it
because I read reviews, lesson learned
